alert.note: Alert for Emanuel (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Toombs, south central Emanuel and northern Montgomery Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Kibbee, or 7 miles northeast of Mount Vernon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lyons, Mount Vernon, Vidalia, Oak Park, Ailey, Higgston, Santa Claus, Tarrytown, Ohoopee, Ponderosa, Kibbee, and Normantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central, southeastern and east central Georgia.
